content.en: Algorithmic treatment of HCC: A recent analysis of scientific abstracts examined the research questions related to the use of algorithms in the treatment of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC), a type of liver cancer. The study found that the BCLC prognostic system is considered the best for surgical HCC patients, but many hepatic surgeons do not follow its guidelines. Additionally, alternative prognostic scores can improve the stratification of HCC patients and the HKLC staging system shows promising results in certain populations. However, clinical practice often deviates from the recommended algorithms, indicating the need for better adherence to improve patient outcomes.
content.da: Algoritmisk behandling af HCC: En nylig analyse af videnskabelige abstracts undersøgte forskningsspørgsmål relateret til brugen af algoritmer i behandlingen af hepatocellulært karcinom (HCC), en type leverkræft. Undersøgelsen fandt, at BCLC-prognosesystemet anses for at være det bedste for kirurgiske HCC-patienter, men mange hepatiske kirurger følger ikke dets retningslinjer. Desuden kan alternative prognosescores forbedre stratificeringen af HCC-patienter, og HKLC-stadievurderingssystemet viser lovende resultater i visse befolkningsgrupper. Klinisk praksis afviger dog ofte fra de anbefalede algoritmer, hvilket indikerer behovet for bedre overholdelse for at forbedre patienternes resultater.
